item.title: GM’s Volt boasts 230 miles per gallon
item.description: General Motors said that its Chevrolet Volt plug-in hybrid car will boast fuel consumption of 230 miles per gallon in city driving, making it the first mass-produced vehicle with triple-digit fuel economy

item.title: CIT delays filing second-quarter results
item.description: CIT Group, the struggling US small-business lender, delayed filing its second-quarter results with the SEC, saying its restructuring efforts meant it was unable to meet the deadline without “unreasonable effort or expense.”

item.title: China’s economy cools as lending slows
item.description: China’s surging economy slowed slightly in July as state-controlled banks heeded Beijing’s instructions to rein in excessive lending, with the volume of new lending dropping 77 per cent from a month earlier

item.title: US productivity grows faster than expected
item.description: Productivity soared by a higher-than-expected 6.4 per cent in the non-farm business sector in the second quarter, its highest level since 2003, as hours worked fell faster than output, the Department of Labor said

item.title: Wall Street slips ahead of Fed prognosis
item.description: US stocks slid on as investors continued to take profits following the recent rally as they waited for further signs on the economic recovery from the Federal Reserve

item.title: Charity chief found dead in Chechnya
item.description: The head of a charity helping children in Russia’s turbulent republic of Chechnya has been found shot dead, together with her husband, the latest in a string of killings of activist to be killed as violence escalates in the region

item.title: Tata secures private funding for Jaguar
item.description: The Indian owner of Jaguar Land Rover has dropped its demands for a large bail-out by the British government after obtaining private sector funding for the struggling carmaker

item.title: Ex-Soviet officer escapes US extradition
item.description: Viktor Bout, the former Soviet military officer suspected of arms trafficking on four continents, has won the first stage of his battle to avoid extradition from Thailand to the US on charges of offering to supply weapons to Colombian rebels

item.title: Deutsche Bank backs €300m Sal Oppenheim injection
item.description: Deutsche Bank has backed a €300m injection of capital for Sal Oppenheim as the two banks discuss a stake in the private bank

item.title: Musharraf faces arrest if he returns to Pakistan
item.description: The former president of Pakistan would face arrest if he returned to Pakistan after police registered a case against him on Tuesday over his detention of judges during a political crisis in 2007
